dcterms:creator: Q. Hu
B. Chi
M. R. Akella
dcterms:description: The Artificial Potential Field (APF) technique is employed to handle the pointing constraint in spacecraft attitude control, providing an economical way to manage obstacles in the spacecraft's path.
dcterms:title: Artificial Potential Field (APF) technique

dcterms:creator: C. P. Bechlioulis
G. A. Rovithakis
dcterms:description: The Prescribed Performance Control (PPC) scheme is utilized to transform the state-constrained control problem into an unconstrained one, ensuring rapid convergence while satisfying performance requirements.
dcterms:title: Prescribed Performance Control (PPC) scheme

dcterms:creator: C. Wei
Q. Chen
J. Liu
Z. Yin
J. Luo
dcterms:description: The Barrier Lyapunov Function (BLF) technique is applied to ensure that the state trajectory remains within a prescribed performance region, thus addressing performance constraints in spacecraft attitude control.
dcterms:title: Barrier Lyapunov Function (BLF) technique

dcterms:creator: Z. Yang
J. Ji
X. Sun
H. Zhu
Q. Zhao
dcterms:description: The Tracking Differentiator (TD) is utilized to generate smooth approximations of differential signals, aiding in the control of the spacecraft's attitude.
dcterms:title: Tracking Differentiator (TD)

dcterms:creator: A. Dongare
R. Hamrah
A. K. Sanyal
dcterms:description: The Reduced-attitude representation is employed to simplify the representation of attitude constraints, facilitating the integration of control schemes for spacecraft.
dcterms:title: Reduced-attitude representation
